projects.title: Sigmatics — Atlas Sigil Algebra Reference Implementation
projects.tagline: TypeScript implementation of the Atlas Sigil Algebra formal specification
projects.description: Sigmatics is the canonical compiler foundation that powers Hologram. It implements a symbolic computation system built on 7 fundamental generators (mark, copy, swap, merge, split, quote, evaluate) and a 96-class resonance structure (≡₉₆). Through pattern-based canonicalization, Sigmatics reduces circuit operations to their minimal canonical forms, enabling the 4-8x performance gains Hologram achieves.
projects.relationship: Sigmatics provides the formal algebraic specification that Hologram's compiler implements. Every Hologram operation compiles through Sigmatics' canonicalization rules to produce optimal generator sequences. The 96-class system and pattern rewriting (H²=I, X²=I, D³=I) are the mathematical foundation enabling Hologram's universal compute acceleration.
features: Dual semantics: literal (byte) and operational (word) backends

projects.title: Atlas Embeddings — Exceptional Lie Groups from First Principles
projects.tagline: Rust formalization proving all 5 exceptional groups emerge from the Atlas
projects.description: Atlas Embeddings demonstrates that all five exceptional Lie groups (G₂, F₄, E₆, E₇, E₈) emerge from a single initial object: the Atlas of Resonance Classes. The Atlas is a 96-vertex graph arising as the unique stationary configuration of an action functional—the same mathematical structure underlying Hologram's class system. Through categorical operations, this one structure generates the complete hierarchy of exceptional symmetries.
projects.relationship: The Atlas provides the mathematical foundation for Hologram's 96-class memory system and resonance structure. Each of Hologram's 96 classes corresponds to a vertex in the Atlas graph. The action functional that produces the Atlas is the same principle ensuring Hologram's canonical forms are mathematically optimal. This research proves the deep mathematical correctness of Hologram's architecture.
features: Complete Atlas → E₈ embedding (96 vertices to 240 roots)
All 5 exceptional groups from categorical operations
Golden Seed Vector: universal embedding structure
No floating point: exact rational arithmetic only

books.title: The Physics of Information
books.description: Fundamental concepts and theoretical foundations of Hologram. Explores information's intrinsic mathematical structure through conservation laws, resonance classes, and the 12,288-cell lattice. Divided into three parts: Foundations (discovering structure), Architecture (implementation principles), and Implications (computing's future).

books.title: Computer Science Formalization
books.description: Complete computer science formalization of the Hologram model of computation. Provides rigorous mathematical foundations, CS analogues, proofs, and implementation code. Includes comprehensive index, glossary, and side-by-side mappings between traditional CS concepts and Hologram equivalents.

books.title: Container Engine and Platform
books.description: Complete conceptual model for the Hologram Container Engine and Platform. Covers container architecture, lifecycle management, composition patterns, and integration with traditional systems. Provides practical guidance for building containerized applications on Hologram.
